thread.title: Texas Rangers tweet 'Fire Charlie' during Longhorns' loss
thread.title_full: Texas Rangers tweet 'Fire Charlie' during Longhorns' loss

title: Texas Rangers tweet 'Fire Charlie' during Longhorns' loss
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Texas Rangers tweet 'Fire Charlie' during Longhorns' loss A bad Texas Longhorns season got even worse Saturday against TCU, as the Horned Frogs scored 50 unanswered points to open the game and eventually won 50-7. Post to Facebook Texas Rangers tweet 'Fire Charlie' during Longhorns' loss A bad Texas Longhorns season got even worse Saturday against TCU, as the Horned Frogs scored 50 unanswered points to open the game and eventually won 50-7.  //kvue.tv/1Rnqx3H   Texas Rangers tweet 'Fire Charlie' during Longhorns' loss Nick Schwartz, USA Today 3:46 p.m. CDT October 3, 2015 Amon G. Carter Stadium on October 3, 2015 in Fort Worth, Texas. (Photo: Tom Pennington) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A bad Texas Longhorns season got even worse Saturday against TCU, as the Horned Frogs scored 50 unanswered points to open the game and eventually won 50-7. With Texas staring at a 1-4 record after Week 5, the person in charge of the official Texas Rangers Twitter account accidentally started a campaign to fire Texas head coach Charlie Strong. 
The Texas Rangers tweeted after the Texas Longhorns' loss, "Fire Charlie." (Photo: USA Today) 
The tweet was quickly deleted, but not before it could be retweeted and screenshotted dozens of times. Surprisingly, it wasnâ€™t the only (or even the worst) Texas football-related social media snafu of the afternoon. Texas freshman Kris Boyd retweeted a message about transferring during the game . 
The person responsible for the tweet has been fired. 
Texas Rangers reports that the person responsible for the tweet has been fired. (Photo: USA Today) Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1Rnqx3H TOP VIDEOS
